Description: Cloak a - fine black wool cloth, originally dark blue(?), main outer cloth of bishops cloak, but surviving only as a few fragments. Surviving attached fragments are along the top of the tapestry panel and above this at the back of the hood. b - hood in fairly plain, coarse cotton cloth. c - plain pale blue silk used in bias-cut strips to decorate the inner edges of the cloak. d - large panel, horizontal oblong, sewn to the back of the bishop's cloak, just below the shoulders. All silk tapestry. x - fragment of fine wool cloth, mainly black warp-faced but with an area of contrasting decoration.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), Church 1 North Crypt Burial of Bishop Timotheos B12
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
